intro: Restio pratensis, commonly known as the marsh restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in coastal and wetland areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and salt marshes. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
